DOC.brief_summary: The effects on brain perfusion of the two currently vasopressors used to treat accidental hypotension occurring during carotid surgery (i.e. ephedrine and phenylephrine) is not known, but a disadvantage to use phenylephrine is suspected, due to its mechanism of action and according to published reports
DOC.brief_title: Compared Efficacy and Tolerance of Two Vasopressors Used to Treat Preoperative Hypotension During Carotid Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: This is a randomised trial comparing ephedrine and phenylephrine as used for accidental hypotension occurring during carotid surgery, on cerebral perfusion, assessed by near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS).
DOC.criteria: Age over 18 ASA score IIII Planned carotid endarteriectomy under general anaesthesia Hypotension defined as SAP < 90 mm Hg during general anaesthesia Informed consent to the trial Protected by the French health welfare Emergency surgery Cardiac arrythmia Pregnancy or breastfeeding Allergy to the tested treatment Allergy to hydroxyethylstarch Allergy to the glue of the NIRS's electrodes Current medication: MAOI, intranasal vasopressors
